author: sky.cactus
content: 2711 and 2718 seem to be pretty stale.  We got a bit of feedback from <@!211091239112671234> on hashing which has since been added to the EIP.  I would like to move both forward and I believe the next step is bringing them both up with the All Core Devs to get general acceptance.

author: sky.cactus
content: Since I can't make All Core Dev calls, does anyone want to champion that?

author: pipermerriam
content: I can't take on championing them but I'm happy to play support for anyone who does.

author: madeof_tin7509
content: This next week is going to be primarily a continuation of the discussion on client diversity.

author: madeof_tin7509
content: But we could to have you on to discuss both things <@364458974906548225>

author: sky.cactus
content: <@!187490121698770945> Is there another way to get "general EIP inclusion consensus" from Core Devs other than the call?  I feel like there are some topics that don't necessarily need a *discussion*, they just need each of the core dev teams to take a look and see if they are for or against a proposal.

author: madeof_tin7509
content: The core dev call is the way. At least for things to move forward in an official capacity. Reaching out to the clients individually can get a lot of the same feedback. Asynchronous participation from clients is something that is requested, but we donâ€™t have a good way record those kind of interactions.

author: madeof_tin7509
content: As we separate the EIP standardization track and the network upgrade track this should become easier.
